<h1>Ryuuganime entries usage</h1>
''This file will guide user on using Ryuuganime Anime Index File, while we trying our best creating this file like API documentation.''

__TOC__

= First guide and initialization =
Currently, we don't have any API for accessing database. Instead, you can use GitHub Raw links to access our data.

For machine-readable index listing, please to use [[index.json]] (recommended) or [[index.yaml]].

We currently provide data in [[/hjson|HJSON]], [[/json|JSON]], and [[/yaml|YAML]]. Thus, all data were standardized by our [[schemas/entry.json|JSON Schema for entry]]. 

This document will covers AIO solution on your project in any programming language.

== Encoding ==
Ryuuganime is using UTF-8 (Unicode) with Windows' End of Line Sequence format (<code>CRLF</code>).

== Client ==
Ryuuganime does not need to create any client first to request API. You only need to use GitHub Raw URL to <code>GET</code>, and you are done!

== Data fetching URI ==
=== File fetching ===
*'''Fetching anime data from repo'''
*:<pre>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ryuuganime/ryuuganime-db/master/json/<RYU-ID>/<RYU-ID>.json</pre>
*:Please keep in mind that you need to change <code><RYU-ID></code> before fetch data.
*'''Fetching anime index list'''
*:<pre>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ryuuganime/ryuuganime-db/master/list.json</pre>

=== Data dumps ===
*'''GitHub Release'''
*:<pre>https://github.com/ryuuganime/ryuuganime-db/releases/latest/download/dumps.tar.gz</pre>
*:All content are gzipped in tarball format.

= Using ryuuganime-db anime entry JSON file =
== Introduction ==
<h1>THIS SECTION IS OUTDATES, PLEASE TO VISIT [https://docuwiki.ryuuganime.my.id RYUUGANIME DOCUWIKI] FRO CURRENT VERSION!</h1>
For our basic usage introduction, we will using <code>RYU-1</code> (Ryuuganime ID: 1) on [[/json/000/001.json|<code>/json/000/001.json</code>]]. 

First, you need to get the latest metadata by request <code>GET</code> HTML data from GitHub Raw:
<pre>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ryuuganime/ryuuganime-db/master/json/000/001.json</pre>

== JSON attributes ==
*Type: Object
*Requires:
*:<code>$schema</code>, <code>title</code>, <code>backdrop</code>, <code>visualKey</code>, <code>synopsis</code>, <code>information</code>, <code>scores</code>, <code>updatedDate</code>, <code>streamLinks</code>, <code>signature</code>
*Additional properties: <code>false</code>

=== $schema ===
Path to Ryuuganime JSON schema for Entry.
*Type: String
**Format: URI
*Pattern: <code>"\.\./\.\./schemas/entry\.json</code> or <code>https://raw\.githubusercontent\.com/ryuuganime/ryuuganime-db/master/schemas/entry\.json</code>

=== title ===
A serial title in multiple languages. Based on ICU locales.
*Type: Object
*Requires:
*:<code>native</code>, <code>en_Latn</code>, <code>ar_001</code>, <code>id_ID</code>, <code>en_US</code>, <code>ja_JP</code>, <code>de_DE</code>, <code>ko_KR</code>, <code>fr_FR</code>, <code>pt_PT</code>, <code>ru_RU</code>, <code>es_ES</code>, <code>zh_Hans</code>, <code>zh_Hant</code>, <code>vi_VN</code>
*Additional properties: <code>true</code>
**Pattern: <code>^[a-z]{2,3}_[\w]{2,4}$</code>
*Not null: <code>false</code>

{|
!Field name
!Type
!Note
|-
|<code>native</code>
|rowspan="15"|String
|A serial title in native/origin language (Canonical). Value can not be empty.
|-
|<code>en_Latn</code>
|Serial title in romanized text. Required for main title on entry list. Value can not be empty.
|-
|<code>ar_001</code>
|Serial title in Modern Standard/Written Arabic (العربية الفصحى).
|-
|<code>id_ID</code>
|Serial title in Indonesian.
|-
|<code>en_US</code>
|Serial title in English (United States) or else.
|-
|<code>ja_JP</code>
|Serial title in Japanese.
|-
|<code>de_DE</code>
|Serial title in German.
|-
|<code>ko_KR</code>
|Serial title in Korean.
|-
|<code>fr_FR</code>
|Serial title in French.
|-
|<code>pt_PT</code>
|Serial title in Portuguese.
|-
|<code>ru_RU</code>
|Serial title in Russian.
|-
|<code>es_ES</code>
|Serial title in Spanish.
|-
|<code>zh_Hans</code>
|Serial title in Simplified Chinese.
|-
|<code>zh_Hant</code>
|Serial title in Traditional Chinese.
|-
|<code>vi_VN</code>
|Serial title in Vietnamese.
|}

=== backdrop ===
A backdrop/background/cover image URI of serial.
*Type: String
**Format: URI
*Pattern: <code>^(https?)://</code>

=== visualKey ===
A visual key/poster image URI of serial.
*Type: String
**Format: URI
*Pattern: <code>^(https?)://</code>

*Requires:

==== releaseYear ====
The year of the serial release, using a integrer/numeral format.
*Type: Number
*Minumum number: 1000
*Maximum number: 2999
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== episode ====
Total episodes of serial.
*Type: Number
*Minumum number: 0
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== releaseDate ====
Start date of serial release, using YYYY-MM-DD format.
*Type: String
**Format: Date
*Pattern: <code>^[12]{1}[0-9]{3}\-([0]{1}[1-9]{1}|[1]{1}[0-2]{1})\-([0-2]{1}[0-9]{1}|[3]{1}[01]{1})</code>
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== endDate ====
End date of serial release, using YYYY-MM-DD format.
*Type: String
**Format: Date
*Pattern: <code>^[12]{1}[0-9]{3}\-([0]{1}[1-9]{1}|[1]{1}[0-2]{1})\-([0-2]{1}[0-9]{1}|[3]{1}[01]{1})</code>
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== duration ====
Duration per serial episode, using minute format.
*Type: Number
*Minumum number: 0
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== totalDuration ====
Total serial duration in minutes.
*Type: Number
*Minumum number: 0
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== studio ====
Studio producing series.
*Type: String ''or'' Array
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== rating ====
Content rating of the serial
*Type: String
*Enum: <code>G0+</code>, <code>PS2+</code>, <code>PG7+</code>, <code>PG13+</code>, <code>R8+</code>, <code>GU21+</code>
*Not null: <code>false</code>

==== isNsfw ====
Mark the serial if contains NSFW content.
*Type: Boolean
*Not null: <code>true</code>

==== adaptation ====
Mark the serial if it's adapted from different source or not.
*Type: Object
*Requires:
*:<code>en_US</code>, <code>id_ID</code>
*Additional properties: <code>false</code>
*Not null: <code>true</code>

=== updatedDate ===
Date and time of latest changes to JSON. Based on ISO 8601.
*Type: String
*Format: Date-Time
*Pattern: 
*:<code>^[12]{1}[0-9]{3}\-([0]{1}[1-9]{1}|[1]{1}[0-2]{1})-([0-2]{1}[0-9]{1}|[3]{1}[01]{1})T([01]{1}[0-9]{1}|[2]{1}[0-4]{1}):([0-5]{1}[0-9]{1}):([0-5]{1}[0-9]{1})(\-|\+)([0]{1}[0-9]{1}|[1]{1}[0-3]{1}):([0-5]{1}[0-9]{1})</code>
